website_summaries.verdict: This hassle-free monochrome printer is a great value choice that's quick to set up and easy to operate.
pros: For the price, this is a capable printer, copier, and scanner with an impressive print speed
cons: The wireless connection can be finicky

customer_reviews.title: Nice to get a good printer
customer_reviews.text: I got this in a few days ago to replace this printer I got 3 months ago, it was horrinle... This brother is a black and white, no fax laser printer. Setup was simple, I don't use the manual to setup, its that easy. printing forms and checks have been outstanding. Its quiet, very fast and hold alot of paper in the tray. Don't let the word compact fool you, their idea of compact is different then canon's, but in a good way. It does not feel cheap, its actually a little heavy and twice the size of my cheap canon compact printer. Overall I would recommend for a good office type printer.
customer_reviews.author: Hope

customer_reviews.title: Wireless issues
customer_reviews.text: This printer was purchased for business use at home. We were not able to get the wireless connection working and called the support. They escalated the issue to the department who turned off the firewall on F-Secure PSB anti-virus program and sent an invoice for $150. I find it unfair and frustrating. The second issue is that the toner cartridge that was sent with the printer barely printed 100 copies and had to be replaced. Only one page at the time can be copied or scanned because there is no auto-feeder on this printer. I would not recommend this printer to anybody for any kind of use.
customer_reviews.author: Lemana Saran

customer_reviews.title: Completely satisfied...
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased this Brother Laser Printer and have to comment on the ease of setup as well as quality black and white printing. The printer connected to my WiFi without an issue. The scanner and copier work great! It seems to be well worth the $ spent!
customer_reviews.author: Edward B

customer_reviews.title: Brother also sucks.
customer_reviews.text: Brother has entered the Scam your customer club. You can only use their overpriced ,chip protected, supplies, " for your protection". That will run until they decided to run. Sadly all of them do the same. Get a previous to Oct 2018 model and take care of it.
customer_reviews.author: Kalicles

customer_reviews.title: HATE this printer. It keeps disconnecting!
customer_reviews.text: I do not use the wifi connection because it would continually disconnect. Now I am plugged directly into my iMac and it STILL says not connected. WTF? Nothing is simple & easy to use on any of this technology crap! This makes me hate technology more and more and more! I JUST WANT TO PRINT SIMPLE THINGS!
customer_reviews.author: From Ky

customer_reviews.title: Lots of problems from the start
customer_reviews.text: This printer was easy to set up and connect to my bluetooth, but one week later it would not print a complete page. After one hour (25 minutes on hold) with Brother tech support it was fixed. One hour later I tried to print wirelessly and the printer was no longer connected to my bluetooth. Hours spent on line trying to fix the connection, nothing worked, so another half hour on hold waiting for a Brother tech support person. I am holding my breath what will go next.
customer_reviews.author: Allen Beck

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I'm really disappointed with this printer. It prints great, and is super fast and quiet, but the scanning is horrible. You need to download an app for your computer to use on IOS. It's a bit clunky and suffers from connection issues, but I can usually get it to work. The real issue is scan size. It cuts off the edges of a letter sized document. So if you have anything close to edge, within 3mm, it will cut it off. I tried reducing copy size, but it doesn't seem to work, and there is no reduction for scanning. If anyone has a fix for this... please let me know.
customer_reviews.author: Sabrina

customer_reviews.title: WLAN NO LONGER WORKING AFTER 1 MONTH USE
customer_reviews.text: THE WIFI CONNECTION IS NOT WORKING ANYMORE, HAD TO GET A USB CABLE WHICH WAS NOT WHAT I WANTED TO DO, I HATE TO SEE CABLES HANGING EVERYWHERE.
customer_reviews.author: TRADER JACK

customer_reviews.title: It prints well and I find it great to find a printout from my Ipad which I ...
customer_reviews.text: This is my second Brother printer. This is an All In One, with the exception of no fax which I didn't need. This is very compact and fit in the same place where I had my old printer. I have only used it a short time but it is wireless and I have been able to use it with my cellphone and Ipad as well as my computer. I have not used the replacement ink as yet as I haven't run out of the original supply. It prints well and I find it great to find a printout from my Ipad which I was never able to do before.
customer_reviews.author: LA Reviews

customer_reviews.title: ok for the price but print quality lacks when printing several in succession
customer_reviews.text: I am excited to be able to print on my promotional heavy postcards. It takes getting the right touch to feed in the postcards via the manual feed without it giving me a jammed error which requires opening and pulling out the cartridge to get going again. However now that I have it down it does ok. But, if I print one after the other the print quality deteriorates markedly; gets splotchy and scattered dots around the print. Perhaps I have to slow down and let it rest a bit after each couple pages, which is ok for my application but could be annoying if you need to print a lot.
customer_reviews.author: Jeffrey P. Wright

customer_reviews.title: No blank pages!
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good. We got this printer because our ink jet printer kept drying out on us and printing blank pages. We have had this printer for a month now and it prints everything just fine, even if we go a week or two without printing anything. Set up was easy. It is a little old school and simplistic as far as the software is concerned, but it is completely functional, just not as pretty as our hp software was. But then again, this printer doesn’t print blank pages, so I would take simplicity every time.
customer_reviews.author: Syllasi

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy
customer_reviews.text: Overall, really happy with this printer. Not needing to change out ink every other print is definitely worth the switch from your average home printer. Pros- it prints quickly, great quality. Ink that came with it lasted through 100 pages. Easy set up for mobile printing. Scanning is easy and great quality. Cons- I hated trying to get it to connect to the computer and print. It does not wake up on it's own out of sleep mode. You have to physically go to the printer and wake it up for it to show connected and available to print via mobile.
customer_reviews.author: Gun Nut 5000

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: SOOOO much cheaper in the long run than a printer that needs ink. I would have spent the cost of the printer over again had I had to replace ink cartridges, and I'm still using the original. No, I don't print much, and it IS B&W, but, it doesn't "dry up", it prints both sides. SO much better than any printer I've had before.
customer_reviews.author: AMaines

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, clear text output.
customer_reviews.text: This model is not listed under "Downloads" on the website. You must search for the model number to be linked to the download. Other than that, wireless installation was a breeze. Very quiet, great clarity of text. I just want to add that a paper jam was an easy fix - I have used this printer daily for almost two months. One paper jam, no other problems. Really impressed. AND so glad not to be buying cartridges every few months. Huge savings!
customer_reviews.author: TreefrogsGA

customer_reviews.title: Printed volume not as advertised
customer_reviews.text: This printer was advertised that it's original Toner Cartridge will print at least 700 pages. Some evaluators predicted 250-500 pages - a large disparity; while others said 500-700 pages with initially shipped toner cartridge. I DID NOT get 80 pages altogether after just one week of use, and the toner indicates it needs replacement.
customer_reviews.author: Bach

customer_reviews.title: Great Alternative !
customer_reviews.text: Although toner isn't as cheap compared to the all-in-one & monochrome laser printers, this is a great alternative for a compact laser printer + scanner. I have been searching a lot before buying this since I would like a laser printer that can do the once in a while scanning. I hated how bulky the all-in-one laser printers are, and if I purchased those small monochrome laser printers then I would have to buy a separate scanner. This little thing solves both problems. It is very compact, about 2/3 the size of an all-in-one, and have the ability to scan when you need to.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Installation
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer/copier/scanner. I would recommend it highly with one caveat: the description implies it will function with XP; it does but it took me hours to attach it (wirelessly). Some of the time was most likely my misinterpretation of instructions. The instructions cover multiple printer instructions so I would occasionally search for functions/buttons from other models. I am assuming that since XP is a rather elderly O/S, that is the reason. Now that It is connected, it works flawlessly. When I attempted to connect irt to my wife's laptop using Windows 10, it took only minutes.
customer_reviews.author: Rancher

customer_reviews.title: Wow
customer_reviews.text: Pros: 1) The large paper tray makes this more of a fill and forget printer than other inexpensive printers. 2) Easy WiFi setup 3) Good B/w print quality 4) if you don’t need color printing, it offers printing at a low cost per page. Cons: 1) It is a big unit. I have it in my office. If I had to place in my kitchen, it would be very conspicuous.
customer_reviews.author: Happy Billmore

customer_reviews.title: Error message and wont print
customer_reviews.text: Horrible printer!! I've had it less than 3 months and when I turn it on the scanner makes a clicking noise. Then a error message pops up and it wont allow me to print anything. Waste of money and I can't return it because they only give you 30 days. Complete B.S.!!!!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Works just fine with MacBook Pro (running macOS Catalina 10.15.5)
customer_reviews.text: I don't know why some reviews say it is not compatible w/ Mac; must be user error. Mine hooked up in less than 5-minutes and prints wonderfully thru bluetooth with my MacBook Pro, my iPhone and my iPad. It's fast and print quality is good. I haven't installed a cartridge other than the starter that came with it. This is my 2nd Brother laser printer though and I liked the last one. I had the old version of the laser black and white that plugged into the back of my desktop and when I moved to a laptop it was no longer compatible (no USB).
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: WHAT A GREAT PRINTER!!
customer_reviews.text: This printer more than lives up to it's reputation, in my opinion. It was really easy to set up wirelessly and can be used from both bedrooms in our apartment. The quality is magnificent and it seems that we are getting a lot of pages out of the supplied toner cartridge. I'm 100% enthusiastic about this wonderful Brother printer!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy install, Easy use
customer_reviews.text: I put five stars in tech support despite not needing tech support. This is a printer I liked so much that after my divorce I let my ex keep the old one and I bought a brand new one. Prints fast, prints clearly, and more importantly, the ink cartridge doesn't dry out after months of non use unlike other cheaper printers with multiple ink cartridges that won't work if a single cartridge has "run out." If you want the occasional color print talk to one of your friends who got suckered into buying one of those POS printers.
customer_reviews.author: Morty

customer_reviews.title: overall, product worth the money, but improvement could be made with the paper tray.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was successful but wireless is hard to set up. Used only for a few days, print a few papers and now it has an error message that there is no paper in tray 1. I reset everything, pull out the tray checked everything, reset the system, power it off/on, but no help. The paper tray is poorly designed and makes the machine thinks that the paper isn't in. I figured out that you have to set the paper size correctly on the tray before push it back in, The way is designed was just odd. Printing quality is okay. I gave it a 3 star since it does the job and the money is affordable compare to other printers.
customer_reviews.author: Steve N.

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: Initial install and impression...so far so good. Recommend going straight to the manufacturer's website to download full package software instead of the disc. Installed with no problem, printed in 10 sec's from hitting print button to paper coming out of the printer. I tested it when it was in deep sleep, it took about 15 secs from print to hard paper. Works really well for me and I have a MacBook Air. Only 4 stars since I'm not sure of the performance longevity, will update if there are any issues.
customer_reviews.author: Martin V.

customer_reviews.title: Blew Arc Fault Circuit Interrupter (AFCI)
customer_reviews.text: I set the printer up following the instructions. As soon as I tried to turn it on it blew the AFCI circuit breaker. I checked to make sure nothing else plugged into that circuit was on. I tried twice more with the same result. Then I returned the printer immediately to Amazon and bought a small HP which has worked perfectly out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: G. M. Smith

customer_reviews.title: GOODBYE Ink printers and HELLO laser!
customer_reviews.text: I have never had a printer this good in my life. Everyone kept telling me to switch to laser and I will NEVER be going back to ink! This prints clean looking pages, and really fast at that. It holds a TON of paper which is great. The Wi-Fi was a cinch to setup and my phone/computers instantly found it on my network, SUPER convenient. Overall I highly recommend this if you are looking for a printer that works great, BUT you have to be willing to sacrifice color (not a problem for me). Thanks!
customer_reviews.author: Rick

customer_reviews.title: Causes Power issues- Urgent Read
customer_reviews.text: This printer drains so much energy, that is causes a power deficit/sag in all other appliances. Your computer, your router, etc...every time you print....This printer must be on a seperate circut from your computer. Possible damage to your computer (modem etc). I would have not purchaced this item had I known. You can buy a line conditioner, but that is more expensive than this printer. Buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it. Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: This printer does not work well with HP laptops. For months I have been trying to print using this printer. I was able to print one or two times before my laptop telling me that something is wrong with the printer driver. This have cost me to miss out on assignments that were due. I have tried using other wireless printers and have had success. Just now trying to use this printer one last time to print out some paperwork for my business is the most stressful thing in the world. If you want to be efficient with out the hassle and the potential failure of this printer then I suggest you avoid this
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: WiFi connectivity... So far... No good...
customer_reviews.text: I have been unsuccessful connecting this device to my network. I've found the "manual" wifi setup instructions. VERY "steppy" and technical. Feel like I'm reading a legal document. I just don't have the patience for it right now. Will try another day. My desktop is on the first floor. This printer is on the second floor (craft room). If the manual set up fails for me, I guess I will have to consider moving my desktop upstairs and use a cable. Could have purchased a different printer for LESS MONEY if I was going to tether it... IJS...
customer_reviews.author: Jax

customer_reviews.title: Great so Far!
customer_reviews.text: Headline says it all, except to note that this printer is blazing fast compared to many. Copies fast too! Really nice printer. Not beautiful to look at but it works so well I can overlook the fact that it won't make it to the metropolitan museum's design exhibit. And it is very reasonably priced. The laser cartridges are also quite reasonable. Comes to a few cents a page including paper cost. Now the only question is how well does it hold up.
customer_reviews.author: Newton Fawcett

customer_reviews.title: Good printer - Poor scanner
customer_reviews.text: The printer works well with no jams. However the scanner is hard to use. If I put the paper to the edge of the glass, resting against the metal guide, it fails to scan close to the edge of the paper. How silly is that? So you have to position the paper about 1/4 inch from the metal edge, which is hard to do if you want the scan to be aligned well. I will have to rig something to help align the paper 1/4 inch from the edge of the glass. I would look elsewhere if you do much scanning, but if you are mainly doing printing, then it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: So far, so good
customer_reviews.text: I’m done with color printers and their scam, overpriced inks so I’m trying this method now. Set up was pretty easy and painless. I just downloaded the app and the rest was a piece of cake. Prints quality is fine. Only gripe is the paper instructions it came with. Not much info there. I winged it. I had no idea how to install the cartridge and couldn’t find details in instructions so I just very delicately figured it out.
customer_reviews.author: hotshot

customer_reviews.title: A very user-friendly wireless printer-scanner
customer_reviews.text: User-friendly right out-of-the-box for a non tech-savvy 83-yr-old! I print mostly black and white and save money having my few color prints made elsewhere. Presently, I am scanning family photographs into my computer for safekeeping, those made long before smartphones. The process is simple and the scans can be in color and in high resolution. I will be giving thumb drives loaded with treasured family photographs to my daughters, grandchildren, brother, sister, nieces and nephew for Christmas 2019!
customer_reviews.author: PrimePatty

customer_reviews.title: 600 dpi maximum scanner resolution
customer_reviews.text: I don't think they mention the poor scanner resolution in the listing. In fact, the only thing I was able to find was a claim of a "1200 resolution". I have no clue what that means, but it is not the scanner resolution as you can see from my screenshots of the possible options: 100, 200, 300, or 600. Other than the fact that we will need to buy a separate scanner, we are happy with this.
customer_reviews.author: suzann nicole

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup and print fast/quiet
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to replace my broken canon ink printer to print kid's homework from school. Have to say it a very good choice. For setup, it only takes me around 20 min from open box. And it also support print from my mobile device, that's super convenient. For print, very fast and quiet. The only thing need to say is that there is no non-slip pad, need to pay attention of the space, I put my own to prevent slip down from desk.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Wasted $100
customer_reviews.text: This printer worked great until about three weeks ago when all of of sudden none of my devices phones, computers, Chromebooks say the printed but nothing comes out and I have reset the network and all devices even my router but nothing prints. I used to back brother products but this is crazy I can not go with out a printer. So I guess I will have to go with HP which I loathe. But I hope theirs works without this problem. Wasted $100.
customer_reviews.author: James Albrecht

customer_reviews.title: GREAT MACHINE!
customer_reviews.text: I initially gave this a negative review because it would not print in landscape no matter how the driver was set I apologize to Brother for that. Turns out that MS Word ignores that setting in favor of its own (I learned that through Brother online chat). This is a great machine with great support.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Wade Rolston

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive Multipurpose Laser Printer
customer_reviews.text: I needed an inexpensive laser printer for use around the house to be able to scan a document every once in awhile. With an ink jet the ink was always dry or the nozzles plugged since in would only be used periodically. This laser printer prints whenever I need it, no matter how long since the last usage. It is a nice small size and prints and scans which were key factors for me. The price was very reasonable.
customer_reviews.author: djl

customer_reviews.title: Unable to clear "Replace Toner"
customer_reviews.text: In the middle of a print job, I get a "replace toner" message. I searched for a method to clear it, but I could not find any method for this printer. Of course, the only method mentioned in the manual is to replace the cartridge. That is not helpful in the middle of a job. I will not give them the satisfaction of buying a replacement from them. This shows a contempt for their customers
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Go wireless!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had gone wireless long ago! I have had a brother all-in-one for years now and it worked fine. Didn't know what I was missing! We recently moved into a new home and I forgot to have the internet company install an outlet in the office. My son-in-law suggested to go wireless rather than have them come out and install another jack in the office. So glad we did. Now my husband can print from his phone and his iPad pro for work, which he was never able to do before. He would send me the documents so that I could print them out for him. Cut out the middleman. Quick, quality printing.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Great value, easy setup
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to install, wireless setup was extremely simple. A fast printer for home/office use. Amazon was cheaper than Staples, I'm a prime member so I did not have to pay shipping. Note, this model does not have a document feeder to copy multiple document s easily. I highly recommend buying this product.
customer_reviews.author: Lawrence Howard Phillips

customer_reviews.title: Needs CD drive...WTH
customer_reviews.text: The printer looks really nice, perfect size and all. I'll never know if it actually works because I'm not about to go buy an external CD drive. Tried downloading the driver, challenges is that the printer is not smart enough to actually talk to the router without help! I'm SO disappointed with Brother, a CD drive are you kidding me 🙄
customer_reviews.author: Birte M. Haakansson

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this because of all the printing I do (medical reports), so I don't need color. It connects wirelessly without a hitch, and is fast and quiet. I couldn't be happier. I purchase a SquareTrade warranty policy with all my electronic items and they are fabulous if/when it comes to needing to replace something within their extended warranty period, which I was able to take advantage of on my previous printer.
customer_reviews.author: Suz

customer_reviews.title: Cheap and good.
customer_reviews.text: We wanted an inexpensive printer for our kid. This thing was under $100 and was super quick to set up with WiFi. Print speed isn't really fast but its fine. It also duplexes which is awesome at this price. This printer is a perfect example of why NOBODY should buy ink jet printers for day to day use. Inexpensive to buy, inexpensive to run, very reliable. (This is my 3rd Brother printer) Note this model does NOT have an auto document feeder for the scan bed. Not a big deal, but something that everyone should know.
customer_reviews.author: D. Mei

customer_reviews.title: This Printer replaced my Dell MFP E514dw
customer_reviews.text: My previous printer would not work correctly for over a year. I gave up on it and replaced it with this printer which was easy to install and to get the AirPrint working for my Apple devices. It does not have as many features as the Dell printer, but it has what I need. I have only had it for a few days, so we'll have to see how it holds up. My older brother has a simple HP laser printer that he has had for 30 years that still works! I don't expect this to last anywhere near that long, but it would be good to get 4 or 5 years of good service. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Brobobeo

customer_reviews.title: Works ok, but lots of places to jam.
customer_reviews.text: This printer was a terrific price and was relatively easy to set up. The down side is that I jammed it and had a hard time figuring out what setting to use for my paper. I didn't realize there were so many types. I also had a hard time finding the jam because there are so many doors on this thing. It looks like it doesn't require much space, but I have to take it off my desk to open everything up and unjam it. Overall, it was the least expensive laser printer I could find. I would rather deal with the occasional jam than a dried up inkjet cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: R. Jones

customer_reviews.title: No more ink! Join the new age!
customer_reviews.text: Love this printer! We upgraded from the old ink printer because we never used it enough and the ink would dry up. Also, our old printer chose when it wanted to be connected and work. This printer is simple and easy to use! The ‘ink’ won’t dry up on us and it prints seemlessly and much more quietly than our old ink. We still have yet to need a new toner cartridge and all of our devices connect to it with ease so we can print from wherever we are in the house from the laptop, iPad, or our smartphones! One less thing in life to worry about!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Fast printing and small form factor.
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic printer! I bought this to replace an old hp inkjet that was burning through expensive ink. Printer is very fast and easy to use. I have not had to replace the toner yet but one of the reasons I bought this printer was because of the inexpensive toner. The printer is very compact as well and does not take up a lot of space
customer_reviews.author: Jason Dahl

customer_reviews.title: Nice Basic Laser BW Scanner - NIGHTMARE NETWORK ISSUES
customer_reviews.text: I like this printer so far. I print a LOT in college and this is already saving me money on ink. The toner than is included won't last long - get a backup with the purchase of the printer. I paid about $30 for two high capacity toners. The scanner works really well too - even on those hard to scan book pages. WiFi is touchy, works most of the time, direct ethernet connection would be better. UPDATE: I am sitting here for the 20th time - can't get ANY of the printer connections to work - RANDOMLY disconnects from the devices... TOTAL NIGHTMARE
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Does NOT Print Envelopes - Not a Good Printer for a Business
customer_reviews.text: I wish I had returned this machine. I do not recommend this printer for an office since it absolutely cannot print envelopes. I bought better envelopes with the hopes that the wrinkles would be eliminated, but they were only reduced somewhat. Leaving the back of the machine open for the purposes of printing envelopes is very inconvenient.
customer_reviews.author: Darkeyes in Michigan

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.  Much better than inkjet
customer_reviews.text: Setup was easy for my windows 10 laptop. Took my wife with her Mac pro a bit longer. This printer was not listed in setup for the Mac but she went to FAQs at brother and it walked her through it. Print quality is great and prints quickly
customer_reviews.author: Ken

customer_reviews.title: Use at home and office
customer_reviews.text: Love these printers and when I get my cartridges and drums here on amazon, an off brand, they're cheap to run too. Have three of them now. One at home and two at my business.
customer_reviews.author: Kerry

customer_reviews.title: Solid Performance Plus
customer_reviews.text: I replaced a popular brand color printer/scanner with this unit because I had never used the color capabilities and was bored with the incessant demand I buy new ink. The Brother is smaller, quieter, and faster, and of course its cartridges are a lot cheaper. I use it as a shared printer on our home network, USB + WIFI, and it serves all our needs. It was easy to install for Windows, and if Windows is your platform, I highly recommend it. I'm donating the color printer to a neighbor who can make better use of it.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis J. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Can't get it to work anymore
customer_reviews.text: I am a pretty basic user. I just want to plug it into my PC and print. I cannot get the printer to work anymore from a print cable. Works fine for my wife printing wireless after she installed Brother SW on. But I won't install SW. I expect the print driver to work by itself.
customer_reviews.author: Mike G

customer_reviews.title: GREAT PRINTER/SCANNE.
customer_reviews.text: My first Brother product - - Pleasantly surprised. Have not yet hooked up wifi connection, but usb method was easy as pie. This machine is very quiet and does not sap power from my pc. Printed at least 700 pages on the starter toner, so the 2390DW looks like it will be a cheap way to print. I've had a Samsung laser printer, which served me well for over six years, but my old scanner was a relic and finally bit the dust, which is why I chose to buy the Brother 2390DW for scanning and printing. I highly recommend this combo scanner/printer! AAAAAA++++++ (NO CONS YET)
customer_reviews.author: poppapug

customer_reviews.title: No more ink jet!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to try a laser printer. Tired of being ripped off buying ink. Best decision I've made lately. This Brother printer is built like a tank. Make sure you have space for it because it is quite larger than an ink jet printer. Works great. Much faster and nearly silent in operation. I'm not a tech person, but my wife and I, with a couple cups of coffee, were able to get it up and running in about 30 mins. We had to connect our chromebooks manually, but that wasn't too difficult. Print quality is great, no more damp feeling papers. If you don't need color, I highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: michael lynch

customer_reviews.title: Duplex printing doesn't work and tech support useless
customer_reviews.text: I like the printer, but it took my husband forever to set up. Then when i went to print the duplex printing caused a paper jam every single time. Normal printing worked fine, but it defeats the purpose of a duplex printer not to print duplex. Called customer service at Brother and got a woman who helped reinstall the WIFI that had mysteriously stopped working, but she was then very rude after the exact same problem occurred that had previously with the paper jam, saying I would get a callback from them in 10 minutes.... 30 minutes later I'm still waiting and NOT impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth A.

customer_reviews.title: Better than expected!
customer_reviews.text: This replaced a nice color printer I have, which is still working fine. But I didn't want to break the bank buying ink, so I bought this laser printer. I love it!!! Prints fast and very sharp. Scanner is a nice addition as I didn't want to be without a scanning and copy capabilities. The price of this is awesome, and replacement cartridges are inexpensive. Love it!!
customer_reviews.author: TwinrocksTop Contributor: Sewing

customer_reviews.title: Brother Compact Monochrome Laser Printer, HLL2390DW
customer_reviews.text: Do not buy -- the printer itself is ok, but you will be blackmailed on the ink cartridge – $40 can print 2 packs of paper if you are lucky – the cartridges are chipped and you can’t replace it with cartridges from other makers.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: Pro: Great replacement for inkjet printer (and the insane cartridge prices) Easy to use and install Wireless range is impressive (the router is on the other side of my house) Con: Deep sleep mode can be tough to wake from (the FAQ lists a couple of solutions)
customer_reviews.author: Steve Diamond

customer_reviews.title: It Works Great!~
customer_reviews.text: Reading multiple reviews of printers, I noted the lowered reviews had to do with installation of Wifi which was a pain. Luckily I only needed a basic printer and purchased a sturdy USB cord for it. It works like a charm, was easy to set up and I quickly set up 2 sided printing. I can select either 600 or 1200 dpi depending on whether I want to conserve the toner. Great product for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: TruthIsStrangerThanFiction

customer_reviews.title: Love this printer
customer_reviews.text: The price was good and the shipping was fast. I knew that I would get the printer with a smaller cartridge but I was not prepared to only be able to print 5 pages before the "Need new print cartridge" came up. Nonetheless, this printer prints quicky and with great results. I still am trying to figure out how to set it up to print by Blue Tooth. You are supposed to be able to do so but thus far Have not been able to achieve it. Guess it requires more tech knowldge than I have.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Hall

customer_reviews.title: Big spooler problems!
customer_reviews.text: I love the print and speed. I have had many, many printers over the years and never had so much hassle as I have with this one. This is the first Brother printer I bought and will be the last. I will stick with HP from now on. It is set up for wireless printing and worked great for a little while, but now? Headaches! I had to learn how to access my print spooler, who does that? Turn it off, turn it on and hope it works. Now all I have is a copier/scanner and not what I really needed, a wireless printer! Do NOT BUY this item.
customer_reviews.author: Caprice R. Burckholter

customer_reviews.title: Easiest printer I have ever set up...
customer_reviews.text: I finally have had enough of inkjet printers that sit and dry out, have connection/install issues, and constantly in need of replacing cartridges. I took the plunge with this brother laserjet and I cannot believe how easy it was to set up wirelessly for all my devices. Windows 10 desktop/laptop and Pixel phone. Prints fast and I have zero issues so far. Even came with toner. The toners seem pretty inexpensive considering what I was paying for inkjet cartridges. I also found videos online where you can reset the toner counter to get a little more life out of the toner so yay. No complaints so far.
customer_reviews.author: Ollie

customer_reviews.title: Works great (so far)
customer_reviews.text: Hope this unit keeps on working as long as the Epson it replaced. I also had a Brother 615 with super tanks (aftermarket) but the head wore out after 2 years and the letters were not crisp. This unit is much nicer as the sharpness is clear and dark. I know you can't really compare laser to inkjet but I was swayed by the cost per sheet to liquid ink - that plus I thought I'd be doing colour but mostly it turned out to be black and white. The unit is very quiet and I haven't had a single incident of it not waking up from deep sleep as some others have mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: Caveat Emptor

customer_reviews.title: Laser, The $40 difference I hope it’s worth it!
customer_reviews.text: This is a black-and-white printer I got tired of those other printers is always running out of ink and then when I try to replace the ink From a ink shop, The computer did some type of update and would not expect my generic ink cartridges!! The ink is more expensive if you go main brand for a color printer. Hopefully with this black and white laser printer it will Worth it, If I do main brands! On the bad side I won’t see that fine small girl at Kinko’s no more :(
customer_reviews.author: Jessie S

customer_reviews.title: You must buy this printer!! Amazing!!
customer_reviews.text: In love!! The best printer I’ve ever had in my life and I’ve had four others!! Will last forever. Ink won’t dry up that’s what o like the most!!
customer_reviews.author: Jess

customer_reviews.title: It's ok.
customer_reviews.text: Not bad, took me an hour to figure out how to make it connect to my Chromebook wirelessly. Unhappy you can't print in color or use photo paper on it either. It's big, had to buy a small table just for it. Other than that, I'm using it a lot and no probs besides finding out can't use the photo paper, it jams.
customer_reviews.author: Donna B.

customer_reviews.title: It works great
customer_reviews.text: I have always been a fan of laser printers. ink printers cost a lot more to run if you do not print daily. Laser printer are perfect for those that only print things a couple times a month. The toner does not dry out like ink cartridges do. I love the fact i can print 2 sided copies with this printer without any hassle.
customer_reviews.author: Todd

customer_reviews.title: Works when asked and has yet to fail to print a document when I hit the "print" button. Hallelujah!
customer_reviews.text: Compact, inexpensive and reliable, just what a black and white laser printer should be. Unlike my inkjet printer, this Brother machine actually prints documents and pictures when I ask and doesn't bother me to constantly replace cyan... and black... and yellow... It also hasn't forced me to join an ink reordering scheme like my HP printer (beware HP buyers... they limit functionality unless you sign up to their services and download intrusive software). Brother asks nothing of me and delivers perfectly printed documents and images at every request. You will need to pry this from my cold dead fingers to separate us. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jack Stonewall

customer_reviews.title: Long lasting powder ink...
customer_reviews.text: I don't need color. When I had ink printers, I had to spend $35 for b/w and more for the color set (the generic inks never worked well or as long as the manufacturer's). When the black laser printers finally came down under $100, I bought one. The only reason I had to get a 2nd one after a year was due to lightening. The laser powder ink never dries. When I want something in color (rarely), I order a print via Office Depot, Staples, etc. Thus, saving $$$.
customer_reviews.author: hotchas

customer_reviews.title: Quality printer for an Excellent price!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this printer... for a laser printer you CANNOT beat the price! It is compact and fits on a desk nicely. The print is clear and crisp and fast! LOVE that you can easily have duplex or single sided printing and the paper tray holds a lot of paper. Because my Mac does not have a cd/dvd drive, I chose to download the drivers from Brothers website. So easy that setup was a breeze! I always wanted a Brother Laser printer and I am so glad I purchased this one.
customer_reviews.author: klip

customer_reviews.title: Total piece of crap, spend a little more it is worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this waste of money for over a year now and am constantly fighting with it. Basically have to reinstall it for every print job, and wi-fi will never recognize a network. Tech said call IT, IT says it's "fixed", but it's not fixed, now they say to trash it---Never ever buy this POC.
customer_reviews.author: DDarko

customer_reviews.title: Brother for life
customer_reviews.text: Works so well! Will never go back to inkjet. Connects over wifi and is mac/pc compatible. Scanner works great, double sided printing works great, everything just WORKS! Is that too much to ask from a printer these days?
customer_reviews.author: Swiss David

customer_reviews.title: good reliable versatile printer
customer_reviews.text: It comes with cartridge so you do not have to buy it outside of the printer purchase. It sleeps after a while, as little as an hour? I own another Brother laser printer from 3 years ago, it still works perfect and it does not have that "auto sleep" feature which according to some reviewers, you have no way of turning off. Other than that, so for so really good, one less star for that auto shut off function. If there's ways to shut it off, let me know.
customer_reviews.author: h.s.

customer_reviews.title: OK quality, finicky to set up
customer_reviews.text: acceptable quality prints, very basic functionality, it prefers to be wired vs. wireless, unless you use iOS products (Apple). it works great with my iPad and iPhone, but with my iMac it has to be wired. my work laptop is Dell, and it can take up to 5 min to print a page when using wifi, very strange. its feeder is fully manual, which I hadn't seen for about 10 years, so don't plan to use it to scan multiple pages, otherwise it will take for ever.
customer_reviews.author: Massoud Vaziri

customer_reviews.title: This printer is better than SEX!!!
customer_reviews.text: I gave it 4 stars, because the USB cable wasn't included in the box. That makes wireless setup much easier. Every thing else has been perfect! We haven't used the copier features yet, but were assuming it will as outstanding as the rest of the features. My wife is a musician, she has printed 1000's of sheets guitar tab, and sheet music since we received the printer. Same outstanding quality on each.
customer_reviews.author: Steve Helton

customer_reviews.title: Great printer
customer_reviews.text: Here in Az inkjet printers clog if not used almost daily due the dry hot weather and low humidity. After going through numerous new toner cartriges with m inkjet printer, I decided to go for the lazor monocrome as I have read often that they due not the dring out and cloging issues. I love my new unit and ir makes wonderful copies. The one drawback with this unit is that the print job exxits the printer in the rearr which make it somewhat inconvinent for me. $ stars for that reason and that alone.
customer_reviews.author: Mecom Carter

customer_reviews.title: No USB Cable
customer_reviews.text: Got it for my Mom, so she can download designs for quilting. Easy setup, and easy for her to use. Very compact for printer with a scanner. She doesn’t want to use WiFi to set it up, so I had to do it usb. I was surprised it didn’t have the usb cable. I don’t know why they couldn’t throw in something that cheap in the box. Good that I build PCs, so I had plenty of spare parts. Great printer only mark was the lack of the cable.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Brother Compact Monochrome Laser Printer, HLL2390DW
customer_reviews.text: This is not a product you should buy. The set up instructions is basically missing. You have to find some guy on youtube who was kind enough to post the step-by-step instructions on how to set up Wifi for this printer. The main problem is though with the cartridge. I used the original printer for just 3 months with occasional printing and today the printer refuses to print saying the toner is low and the cartridge should be replaced. What?? It should last like for 2 years at least. Do not buy this product and overall, I never was happy with this company.
customer_reviews.author: Tim

customer_reviews.title: Will it work
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my Mac Pro LT, which said would work. Well it does not. Was on line with tech support and finally said Oh... this will not work on a Mac Pro lap top. Difficult directions, before buying you can go on line, please do go to web site and ask if you can install this on your computer first. One good thing....took it back without question.
customer_reviews.author: Sally

customer_reviews.title: Great function for price
customer_reviews.text: Was glad I decided to give this a try. Quality of print is like the printers in the office. Got this for my home office. It's quite. Best of all, it prints double sided without having to flip the paper!!!! Pretty easy to setup driver - downloaded it from their website.
customer_reviews.author: Mai Schroder

customer_reviews.title: Best Printer Ever!
customer_reviews.text: LOVE THIS PRINTER! Was trying to replace my HP Envy series, which was a nightmare. They actually wanted me to pay per printed page. Bull. Anywayyyyy, this printer is FAR easier to set up that my last one. I've never been able to enable the wifi printing on any other printer before. This one, was a piece of cake and that says something because I'm not technologically proficient. It prints great, no smudges, and it's super fast. Love it!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer and doesn't empty your wallet. It prints clean pictures quickly and quietly. It was easy to set up the wireless connection. I would say the only thing I don't like about it is that you have to go wake it up out of sleep mode before you can print to it. This is fairly standard I know but I have not found an easier way to wake it up than to push scan and then immediately cancel it.
customer_reviews.author: Buckhunter88

customer_reviews.title: Fast little machine
customer_reviews.text: This is a fast little machine. I love that it actually prints! I had a Brother inkjet printer for less than a year and it stopped working. This laser printer seems like it will last longer. It is a great, small size, so it will fit almost anywhere. The print quality is not the best, however, as it does not pick up all of the images when copying (with factory settings). Playing with the settings might help. Great printer for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked for a grand total of 18 months
customer_reviews.text: The machine worked like a charm for a year and half. I even moved the computer from one house to another during that time and had no issues powering up and connecting to a network. After 18 months, however, my computer and mobile devices could no longer detect the printer. Went through every page of online trouble shooting that Brother offered. Wasted hours with their customer support and am now left with a non-functional piece of trash on my desktop. This is my first and last Brother product... Please don't waste your time trying to work with their "customer support"
customer_reviews.author: Greg Moyer

customer_reviews.title: Not the printer for you if you print a lot of envelopes
customer_reviews.text: Overall, the printer has been great. No issues with WiFi, small enough to fit into my space. But if you print a lot of envelopes, this is NOT the printer for you. It crumples them up and jams consistently. I tend to print 10 or 12 of the same envelope at a time and they will not feed through the tray and if you manually feed them, you get the "printer jam" message after every other envelope which forces you to open the front and pull out the toner cartridge before it will print again. I like to run my Christmas card envelopes through the printer. Not this year, I'll be printing labels.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Will never go back to Inkjet. Ever.
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box and printing wirelessly within 20 minutes. And I’m the anti I.T. guy. Reserving final scoring/ judgment til I see how often the wireless drops and how long the starter cartridge of ink lasts. But so far I really like it particularly at $99.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and Effective
customer_reviews.text: Solid and effective machine; just like home printers used to be and setup is easy. It scans and copies and can be connected via cable or wifi. This machine prints in black. It replaced my fancy, color, photo printer that was always out of or had expired ink.
customer_reviews.author: sunnyinoregon

customer_reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised at easy setup!!
customer_reviews.text: Like so many others, I HAD to replace my HP deskjet printer bc I didn't use it enough to keep the ink from drying up. Bought this after doing research and I have to say, it's been the besr purchase I've made in a looong time. It was super easy to setup and the print quality and speed of printing is outstanding! I even printed wirelessly from my cell today! Plus one for Gen X! (haha) 😊
customer_reviews.author: Spaniel_love

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: So far this is working very well. Very very easy to set up! And I don’t think we will be running out of ink anytime soon like the other cartridge style printers. It only prints in black and gray but we don’t care and we are happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: LISA LOUTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Works well, updated the firmware first thing
customer_reviews.text: No complaints so far, didn't realize it doesn't have ethernet and is only Wi-Fi. I have not experienced the same wi-fi issues as everyone else, but a coworker of mine has a similar printer and said it took about a year to start having the issue. I'm just happy to be done with ink jet printers. It's fast and cheap and I've printed more on this then I have on all my previous printers combined, and I'm still on the first cartridge.
customer_reviews.author: Zaq

customer_reviews.title: Good home toner printer
customer_reviews.text: purchased to support COVID19 distance learning. I'm very happy with it. Easy to set up. Easy to connect with home wifi, connect with computer and i can print from my phone easily. I didn't want the hassle and price of color cartridges.
customer_reviews.author: ccc

customer_reviews.title: Boat anchor after six months
customer_reviews.text: Mechanical fault after only six months. Passed the return and support window. Now a boat anchor. Thanks Brother and Amazon. Update: I called Brother, and they agreed to replace the unit. So that's good, it was still under the manufacturer warranty. So I'll add another star for that.
customer_reviews.author: joebor

customer_reviews.title: Great printer to get away from those darn ink jets!
customer_reviews.text: After several weeks the printer is working great. The only downside I have found is it will not auto wake up from sleep mode when you print to it, you have to press the power button to wake it up. In truth though, there may be a setting I have not found for this(?)
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: This printer is a confusing mess if you want to scan anything
customer_reviews.text: If you want to scan anything, this printer/scanner stops you cold at your every move. Press the "scan" button and you instead get copy options. After fiddling about for five minutes, if you actually get it into scan mode, you have to hit about six different buttons to get it to engage and actually get the job done. This is one of the least intuitive, user-friendly devices I've ever had in my office. It's a massive time waster.
customer_reviews.author: Logan Londres

customer_reviews.title: Best printer I've ever got
customer_reviews.text: Best printer I've ever got. It's cheap, the toner lasts for thousands of pages and the toner is cheaper than a jet ink cartridge. The quality is just OK. It misses spots in some letters. But its not important to me. Its all I ask for and is suitable for its wonderful price. For my lifestyle, I use it for black and white printing, business documents, college work, never color printing or anything that needs good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Diing

customer_reviews.title: Good laser printer for price!
customer_reviews.text: Found best to copy and scan rom my cell phone. Really nice printer, but 120 lb. card stock still got jammed in printer. Stay below 100 lb. card stock. Hoping my alcohol markers work on the card stock and not bleed. Waiting for 80lb. Card stock and hope it works. I watched a couple YouTube videos to get set up right. Once it connects with your internet wi-fi then Network key is your password. It prints black, but was all I needed. I use my cell to scan and print. Printing paper works fine.
customer_reviews.author: Belinda Williston

customer_reviews.title: Didn't last 6 months nor 400 pages
customer_reviews.text: I bought this less than 6 months ago and it is already not working. I haven't changed toner yet... Worst $100 I ever spent on Amazon.
customer_reviews.author: Maurice P.

customer_reviews.title: Should get >stars or none at all.
customer_reviews.text: I gave this product a 2nd chance after the first one went down. Not only are these printers useless in less than a year and a half, but the customer service at Brother is downright UNETHICAL!! Tech support couldn't explain or fix muy issue but tried really hard to sell me unnecessary security programs. Awful experience. Do not Bother with Brother. I deserve a complete refund on two of these useless plastic boxes and the cartridges of toner too.
customer_reviews.author: straycat graphics samantha fairchild

product_meta.title: Brother Compact Monochrome Laser Printer, HLL2390DW, Convenient Flatbed Copy & Scan, Wireless Printing, Duplex Two-Sided Printing, Amazon Dash Replenishment Ready
product_meta.description:
Style:New Model: Hl-L2390DW

Infused with Brother’s latest technology and designed to enhance office efficiency, the Brother HL L2390DW is a reliable, robust, and affordable monochrome laser printer with copying and scanning capabilities that is perfect for the home or small office. The modern and updated replacement for the reliable Brother DCPL2520DW is built with a flatbed scan glass that provides convenient copying and scanning. It has also been updated with new features that allow users to scan and print directly from mobile devices, including tablets, and cloud based accounts.

The HL L2390DW has been upgraded to optimize printing to meet the evolving needs of modern business. With lightning quick precision, the Brother monochrome laser printer features a class leading print speed of up to 32 pages per minute. You can easily connect via built in wireless network and USB interfaces and print wireless from your mobile devices. The automatic duplex printing feature helps save paper, and using Brother Genuine high yield replacement toner (TN 760) can help lower print costs (also compatible with TN 730 replacement toner cartridge). The tray with the capacity to hold up to 250 sheets helps improve efficiency with less refills and handles both letter and legal sized paper.

Brother is dedicated to superior customer service and stands by our products by offering a 1 year limited warranty on this new monochrome laser printer. We also provide free online, call, or live chat support for the life of your printer. At Brother, we want to ensure that your experience with us is exceptional. If you have been looking for an exceptional monochrome laser printer with fast printing capacity and multiple user friendly features, add the Brother HL L2390DW to your Amazon shopping cart today.

(1) Based on competing in class monochrome laser printers under 200 dollars. Print speed specifications gathered from manufacturer websites as of 1/9/2017.(2) Requires connection to a wireless network.(3) TN 760 High Yield vs. TN 730 Standard Yield. Up to two times more prints and lower printing costs based on yields and MSRP. Standard Yield and High yield cartridges sold separately.(4) Approx. toner cartridge yield in accordance with ISO/IEC 19752 (letter/A4).(5) Reprinted from PCMag with permission. Copyright 2017 Ziff Davis, LLC. All Rights Reserved.(6) The mobile device must have NFC capability and run Android OS 4.4 or later. Compatibility : ITU T Super Group 3 

Standard Interface(s):Wireless 802.11 b/g/n, Hi-Speed USB 2.0, Wi-Fi Direct.
feature_bullets: Engineered for productivity: Brother’s latest technology is infused into the HL L2390DW. Equipped with a flatbed scan glass for convenient copying, this monochrome laser printer is engineered to scan directly from mobile devices
Print more, wait less: Developed to optimize efficiency, this replacement for the DCPL2520DW produces a robust and class leading print speed of up to 32 pages per minute (1)

New, user friendly features : This new Brother monochrome laser printer includes a 250 sheet paper capacity, which helps improve office efficiency with less refills. The HLL2390DW also handles legal and letter sized paper
Flexible printing: Print envelopes, card stock, and multiple sized paper through the easy to access manual feed slot, allowing you to create professional looking documents with high resolution

Wireless printing & exceptional support : The easy to link wireless technology allows you to submit print jobs from your laptop, smartphone, desktop, and tablets (2). We provide free online, call, or live chat support for the life of your printer. At Brother, we want to ensure that your experience with us is exceptional
Amazon dash replenishment enabled: Upon activation, Amazon Dash Replenishment measures the toner level and orders more from Amazon when it’s low

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars2,573 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
